definitions.definition: A professional person qualified (as by a law degree or bar exam) and authorized to practice law, i.e. represent parties in lawsuits or trials and give legal advice.
definitions.example: A lawyer's time and advice are his stock in trade. - aphorism often credited to Abraham Lincoln, but without attestation

definitions.definition: (by extension) A legal layman who argues points of law.
To perform, or attempt to perform, the work of a lawyer.
To barrage (a person) with questions in order to get them to admit something.
